content.question: If Zeta, a single producer, had exclusive control of a key resource needed to produce good <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></math> , a likely result would be which of the following?

choices.label: Good <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> would be produced in a perfectly competitive market.

Slight differences in output would lead to good <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> being in a monopolistically competitive market.
There would be a barrier to entry, and Zeta would have a monopoly on good <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Only a few firms would produce good <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, so there would be an oligopoly.

Zeta must have decreasing returns to scale and operate as a natural monopoly in producing good <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: There would be a barrier to entry, and Zeta would have a monopoly on good <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
